To store the count of clicks on a like button for a particular card while looping through in a React functional component and restrict the user from clicking more than once, you can use a combination of state management and conditional rendering. Here's an example of how you can achieve this:

```jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';

const CardComponent = () => {
  const [likes, setLikes] = useState([]);

  const handleLikeClick = (cardId) => {
    const updatedLikes = likes.map((item) => {
      if (item.cardId === cardId) {
        // If the card is already liked, do not update the count
        if (item.liked) {
          return item;
        }
        // Increment the count and set liked to true
        return { ...item, count: item.count + 1, liked: true };
      }
      return item;
    });

    setLikes(updatedLikes);
  };

  return (
    <div>
      {/* Render your cards here */}
      {cards.map((card) => {
        const likeInfo = likes.find((item) => item.cardId === card.id);
        const isLiked = likeInfo ? likeInfo.liked : false;
        const likeCount = likeInfo ? likeInfo.count : 0;

        return (
          <div key={card.id}>
            <h3>{card.title}</h3>
            {/* Render your card content */}
            {/* Add a like button */}
            <button
              onClick={() => handleLikeClick(card.id)}
              disabled={isLiked} // Disable the button if already liked
            >
              {isLiked ? 'Liked' : 'Like'}
            </button>
            <span>{likeCount} Likes</span>
          </div>
        );
      })}
    </div>
  );
};

export default CardComponent;
```

In this example, we use an array of objects to store the likes for each card. Each object contains the `cardId`, `count` of likes, and a `liked` flag to track if the user has already liked the card.

The `handleLikeClick` function is called when the like button is clicked. It maps through the `likes` array and increments the count and sets the `liked` flag to true if the card is found. If the card is already liked, it does not update the count.

The `isLiked` and `likeCount` variables are used for conditional rendering. They determine whether the like button is disabled (`disabled={isLiked}`) and display the appropriate text and count based on the state.

By disabling the like button after the user has clicked it, you can restrict them from clicking more than once.
